meanings.definition: Capable of being revived or brought back to life.
meanings.sent1: The plant looked revivable after I watered it.
meanings.sent2: The doctor said the patient was revivable with proper treatment.
meanings.sent3: The old car seemed revivable after a good wash.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was revivable with some encouragement.
meanings.sent5: The hope for a better future was as revivable as a flickering flame.

meanings.definition: Able to be restored to consciousness or vitality.
meanings.sent1: The faint heartbeat was a sign that he was revivable.
meanings.sent2: The medicine made her feel more revivable after a few hours.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat looked surprisingly revivable when it heard the sound of a can opener.
meanings.sent4: His energy levels were as revivable as a rechargeable battery.
meanings.sent5: The music had a revivable effect on her mood, lifting her spirits instantly.
